Body: In the kaa endpoint SDK documentation it lists a few of the supported operating system platforms: Linux
column15:
QnxNeutrinoRtos.

I have two questions:

How can you generate a SDK for a new platform that is not similar to the above? I'm looking at small MCU's with little flash and RAM with a minimal possible SDK.

A previous SO mentions the future plans to support REST
column17: and CoAP. While a kaa documention states that the 1/KP protocol implementation supports MQTT and is well-thought to enable future CoAP binding. That's saying MQTT is done. Are the REST and CoAP features currently implemented or being worked on
column18:
any documentations or official information about that?
